question: This new solar power project is touted as the largest in the world. It is spread over 13,000 acres and five villages. It is located in the drought-prone Pavagada region of Tumkur district of Karnataka. Recently, the state government inaugurated the first phase of this 2,000 megawatts (MW) solar park. The name of the solar park is _?
explanation: The Karnataka government recently inaugurated the first phase of the 2,000 megawatts (MW) solar park located in the drought-prone Pavagada region of Tumkur district, in Karnataka. The first phase will generate 600MW, while the balance 1,400MW will be made operational very soon. This solar power project is touted as the largest in the world. The development of this solar park was initiated with the creation of the Karnataka Solar Power Development Corp. Ltd (KSPDCL) in March 2015 as a joint venture between Karnataka Renewable Energy Development Ltd (KREDL) and Solar Energy Corp. of India (SECI).
